edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.GameObject
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<GameObject>

    public class Player
extends GameObject
    This Player class will contain parameters that will define the player's status, upgrade status, position, and number of lives. In addition, the methods contained within the class will give the player actions (look, shoot, move, pick up items) as well as reactions (death, shield, radar, new bullet).
    Author:
    Dylan Nguyen, Andrew Nipp, Andrew Niklas, Ben Nickerson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        This constructor creates the Player object by calling its super constructor GameObject.GameObject(String, int, int), and passing "[P]", 0, and 8 as its respective parameters. It then calls GameObject.setHiddenName(String), GameObject.setRealName(String), and GameObject.setObjectName(String) with "[P]" as the parameter for each. It does this since the Player should never be a hidden object. Finally it sets the initial conditions of xPosition, yPosition, ammo, numLives, objID, and plrMoveDir to their necessary values.

    • Method Detail

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(java.lang.String input)
        This method will move the player based on user input, which is passed as a String and forced to lower case. It then uses a switch statement and checks each potential input - the switch statement serves to ensure that the String has the proper value "up", "down", "left", or "right" before continuing on an if-else if statement that checks whether the move is possible. It then moves the Player by calling GameObject.setXY(int, int) with the appropriate parameters before finally setting plrMoveDir to the value of the String that was passed an modified.
        Parameters:
        input - - String that contains the user's input, it will be changed to the standard format of plrMoveDir before finally being saved in that field.

      • naturalVision

        public void naturalVision(java.lang.String direction,
                          Grid grid)
        This method will reveal a location one block ahead of wherever the Player is looking. It does this by using a String containing the direction that the Player is looking and the Grid object and passing it to a switch statement. Based on the String it will call either lookUp(), lookDown(Grid), lookRight(), or lookLeft(); for each case it will then call Grid.showPlayerDefaultVision(int, int, boolean), passing one of the lookPositions in each integer and true. The default statement should not be called, but will print an error message just in case.
        Parameters:
        direction - - String containing the direction that the character is looking
        grid - - Grid object in the game state

      • removeNaturalVision

        public void removeNaturalVision(java.lang.String direction,
                                Grid grid)
        This method will remove a location visible from wherever the Player was looking. It does this by using a String containing the direction that the Player is looking and the Grid object and passing it to a switch statement. Based on the String it will call either lookUp(), lookDown(Grid), lookRight(), or lookLeft(); for each case it will then call Grid.showPlayerDefaultVision(int, int, boolean), passing one of the lookPositions in each integer and false. The default statement should not be called, but will print an error message just in case.
        Parameters:
        direction - - String containing the direction that the character is looking
        grid - - Grid object in the game state

      • playerLook

        public void playerLook(Grid grid,
                       java.lang.String direction)
        This method will reveal two spaces in the desired direction on the Grid based on user input. It does this by using a String containing the direction that the Player is looking and the Grid object and passing it to a switch statement. Based on the String it will call either lookUp(), lookDown(Grid), lookRight(), or lookLeft(); for each case it will then call Grid.showObjectsWithinLocation(int, int, int, int, boolean) and Grid.lookReport(int, int, int, int) where the integers are all of the lookPositions, and the boolean is true. The default condition should not be met, but will print an error message if it is.
        Parameters:
        direction - - String containing the direction that the character is looking
        grid - - Grid object in the game state

      • stopLooking

        public void stopLooking(Grid grid,
                        java.lang.String direction)

      • lookUp

        public void lookUp()
        This method will set the lookPositions to their necessary values. Primarily, the only fields that change are lookPosY1 and lookPosY2 which will be subtracted by 1 and 2 respectively. This only occurs after it calls GameObject.roomExists(int, int) and the value returns true.

      • lookDown

        public void lookDown(Grid grid)
        This method will set the lookPositions to their necessary values. Primarily, the only fields that change are lookPosY1 and lookPosY2 which will be incremented up by 1 and 2 respectively. This only occurs after it calls GameObject.roomExists(int, int) and the value returns true.

      • lookRight

        public void lookRight()
        This method will set the lookPositions to their necessary values. Primarily, the only fields that change are lookPosX1 and lookPosX2 which will be incremented up by 1 and 2 respectively. This only occurs after it calls GameObject.roomExists(int, int) and the value returns true.

      • lookLeft

        public void lookLeft()
        This method will set the lookPositions to their necessary values. Primarily, the only fields that change are lookPosX1 and lookPosX2 which will be subtracted by 1 and 2 respectively. This only occurs after it calls GameObject.roomExists(int, int) and the value returns true.

      • checkBulletPossession

        public boolean checkBulletPossession()
        This method will check if there is a bullet in the gun of the player, basically returning true if ammo is greater than 0 and false otherwise. It will be used to determine if pickUpBullet(int) and useBullet() can be executed or not
        Returns:
        - boolean true when ammo is greater than 0, and false otherwise

      • pickUpBullet

        public void pickUpBullet(int amount)
        This method will add an int, passed as a parameter, to ammo if it is called.
        Parameters:
        amount - - int containing some value to be added to ammo.

      • forceAmmo

        public void forceAmmo(int ammo)
        This method will change ammo to whatever int the parameter holds.
        Parameters:
        ammo - - int containing the value that ammo will be set to

      • useBullet

        public void useBullet()
        This method will decrement ammo by 1 when it is called.

      • playerDies

        public void playerDies()
        This method will check if the enemy has attack the player and kill the player by resetting their location to the initial spawn and decrementing numLives by 1.

      • checkbreifcase

        private void checkbreifcase(int lookPosY1,
                            int lookPosX1,
                            Grid grid)
        This method checks whether or not the Room object contains the bomb. It does this by using lookPosY1 and lookPosX1 along with the Grid as parameters; then it calls Grid.getBCpos() and checks whether the lookPositions are equal to the position of the bomb. If they are, it will return true. Otherwise, it will return false and finally call GameObject.roomExists(int, int) to determine whether there was a Room at that location before printing the message that the reactor is clear.
        Parameters:
        lookPosY1 - - int lookPosY1
        lookPosX1 - - int lookPosX1
        grid - - Grid

      • getHasBriefCase

        public boolean getHasBriefCase()
        This method will pass hasBriefCase to whatever calls it
        Returns:
        - boolean hasBriefCase

      • getBriefCase

        public void getBriefCase(boolean hasBriefCase)
        This method will set hasBriefCase to true regardless of its initial value
        Parameters:
        hasBriefCase - - boolean which is true when the bomb is found and false otherwise

      • getNumLives

        public int getNumLives()
        This method will pass numLives to whatever calls it
        Returns:
        - int numLives
